checks.name: cluster_audit_logging_enabled
checks.title: Ensure that cluster audit logging is enabled to aide in compliance and incident investigation
checks.risk: Enabling cluster audit logging in Amazon Redshift enhances security by providing detailed records of database activities, aiding in monitoring, incident investigation, and compliance.

detect.manual: Open the Amazon Redshift Console -> Navigate to the 'Clusters' section -> Select the Redshift cluster ->In the 'Cluster details' tab, check the 'Audit logging' section.

remediation.text: In the 'Cluster details' tab -> click 'Modify' Under 'Audit logging' -> enable or modify the settings -> Save the changes.

checks.name: cluster_publicly_accessible
checks.title: Ensure that Redshift clusters are not publicly Accessible.
checks.risk: Publicly accessible services could expose sensitive data to bad actors.

remediation.text: List all shared Redshift clusters and make sure there is a business reason for them.
